parameter.name: completionEager
parameter.description: Sets whether to complete the idempotent consumer eager or when the exchange is done. If this option is true to complete eager then the idempotent consumer will trigger its completion when the exchange reached the end of the block of the idempotent consumer pattern. So if the exchange is continued routed after the block ends then whatever happens there does not affect the state. If this option is false (default) to not complete eager then the idempotent consumer will complete when the exchange is done being routed. So if the exchange is continued routed after the block ends then whatever happens there also affect the state. For example if the exchange failed due to an exception then the state of the idempotent consumer will be a rollback.

parameter.name: skipDuplicate
parameter.description: Sets whether to skip duplicates or not. The default behavior is to skip duplicates. A duplicate message would have the Exchange property link org.apache.camel.ExchangeDUPLICATE_MESSAGE set to a link BooleanTRUE value. A none duplicate message will not have this property set.

parameter.name: expression
parameter.description: Expression used to calculate the correlation key to use for duplicate check. The Exchange which has the same correlation key is regarded as a duplicate and will be rejected.

parameter.name: eager
parameter.description: Sets whether to eagerly add the key to the idempotent repository or wait until the exchange is complete. Eager is default enabled.

parameter.name: messageIdRepositoryRef
parameter.description: Sets the reference name of the message id repository

parameter.name: removeOnFailure
parameter.description: Sets whether to remove or keep the key on failure. The default behavior is to remove the key on failure.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: Sets the description of this node

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Sets the id of this node

parameter.name: metricsRollingPercentileEnabled
parameter.description: Whether percentile metrics should be captured using HystrixRollingPercentile inside HystrixCommandMetrics.

parameter.name: circuitBreakerForceOpen
parameter.description: If true the HystrixCircuitBreaker.allowRequest() will always return false causing the circuit to be open (tripped) and reject all requests. This property takes precedence over circuitBreakerForceClosed();

parameter.name: circuitBreakerEnabled
parameter.description: Whether to use a HystrixCircuitBreaker or not. If false no circuit-breaker logic will be used and all requests permitted. This is similar in effect to circuitBreakerForceClosed() except that continues tracking metrics and knowing whether it should be open/closed this property results in not even instantiating a circuit-breaker.

parameter.name: fallbackIsolationSemaphoreMaxConcurrentRequests
parameter.description: Number of concurrent requests permitted to HystrixCommand.getFallback(). Requests beyond the concurrent limit will fail-fast and not attempt retrieving a fallback.

parameter.name: circuitBreakerRequestVolumeThreshold
parameter.description: Minimum number of requests in the metricsRollingStatisticalWindowInMilliseconds() that must exist before the HystrixCircuitBreaker will trip. If below this number the circuit will not trip regardless of error percentage.

parameter.name: groupKey
parameter.description: Sets the group key to use. The default value is CamelHystrix.

parameter.name: metricsRollingStatisticalWindowBuckets
parameter.description: Number of buckets the rolling statistical window is broken into. This is passed into HystrixRollingNumber inside HystrixCommandMetrics.

parameter.name: threadPoolKey
parameter.description: Sets the thread pool key to use. Will by default use the same value as groupKey has been configured to use.

parameter.name: metricsRollingStatisticalWindowInMilliseconds
parameter.description: Duration of statistical rolling window in milliseconds. This is passed into HystrixRollingNumber inside HystrixCommandMetrics.

parameter.name: queueSizeRejectionThreshold
parameter.description: Queue size rejection threshold is an artificial max size at which rejections will occur even if link maxQueueSize has not been reached. This is done because the link maxQueueSize of a BlockingQueue can not be dynamically changed and we want to support dynamically changing the queue size that affects rejections. This is used by HystrixCommand when queuing a thread for execution.

parameter.name: fallbackEnabled
parameter.description: Whether HystrixCommand.getFallback() should be attempted when failure occurs.

parameter.name: threadPoolRollingNumberStatisticalWindowInMilliseconds
parameter.description: Duration of statistical rolling window in milliseconds. This is passed into HystrixRollingNumber inside each HystrixThreadPoolMetrics instance.

parameter.name: maxQueueSize
parameter.description: Max queue size that gets passed to BlockingQueue in HystrixConcurrencyStrategy.getBlockingQueue(int) This should only affect the instantiation of a threadpool - it is not eliglible to change a queue size on the fly. For that use queueSizeRejectionThreshold().

parameter.name: circuitBreakerSleepWindowInMilliseconds
parameter.description: The time in milliseconds after a HystrixCircuitBreaker trips open that it should wait before trying requests again.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Sets the value of the id property.

parameter.name: keepAliveTime
parameter.description: Keep-alive time in minutes that gets passed to link ThreadPoolExecutorsetKeepAliveTime(long TimeUnit)

parameter.name: executionIsolationThreadInterruptOnTimeout
parameter.description: Whether the execution thread should attempt an interrupt (using link Futurecancel) when a thread times out. Applicable only when executionIsolationStrategy() == THREAD.

parameter.name: executionTimeoutInMilliseconds
parameter.description: Time in milliseconds at which point the command will timeout and halt execution. If link executionIsolationThreadInterruptOnTimeout == true and the command is thread-isolated the executing thread will be interrupted. If the command is semaphore-isolated and a HystrixObservableCommand that command will get unsubscribed.

parameter.name: executionIsolationSemaphoreMaxConcurrentRequests
parameter.description: Number of concurrent requests permitted to HystrixCommand.run(). Requests beyond the concurrent limit will be rejected. Applicable only when executionIsolationStrategy == SEMAPHORE.

parameter.name: requestLogEnabled
parameter.description: Whether HystrixCommand execution and events should be logged to HystrixRequestLog.

parameter.name: circuitBreakerErrorThresholdPercentage
parameter.description: Error percentage threshold (as whole number such as 50) at which point the circuit breaker will trip open and reject requests. It will stay tripped for the duration defined in circuitBreakerSleepWindowInMilliseconds; The error percentage this is compared against comes from HystrixCommandMetrics.getHealthCounts().

parameter.name: executionTimeoutEnabled
parameter.description: Whether the timeout mechanism is enabled for this command

parameter.name: threadPoolRollingNumberStatisticalWindowBuckets
parameter.description: Number of buckets the rolling statistical window is broken into. This is passed into HystrixRollingNumber inside each HystrixThreadPoolMetrics instance.

parameter.name: circuitBreakerForceClosed
parameter.description: If true the HystrixCircuitBreakerallowRequest() will always return true to allow requests regardless of the error percentage from HystrixCommandMetrics.getHealthCounts(). The circuitBreakerForceOpen() property takes precedence so if it set to true this property does nothing.

parameter.name: corePoolSize
parameter.description: Core thread-pool size that gets passed to link java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutorsetCorePoolSize(int)

parameter.name: metricsRollingPercentileWindowInMilliseconds
parameter.description: Duration of percentile rolling window in milliseconds. This is passed into HystrixRollingPercentile inside HystrixCommandMetrics.

parameter.name: executionIsolationStrategy
parameter.description: What isolation strategy HystrixCommand.run() will be executed with. If THREAD then it will be executed on a separate thread and concurrent requests limited by the number of threads in the thread-pool. If SEMAPHORE then it will be executed on the calling thread and concurrent requests limited by the semaphore count.

parameter.name: metricsHealthSnapshotIntervalInMilliseconds
parameter.description: Time in milliseconds to wait between allowing health snapshots to be taken that calculate success and error percentages and affect HystrixCircuitBreaker.isOpen() status. On high-volume circuits the continual calculation of error percentage can become CPU intensive thus this controls how often it is calculated.

parameter.name: metricsRollingPercentileWindowBuckets
parameter.description: Number of buckets the rolling percentile window is broken into. This is passed into HystrixRollingPercentile inside HystrixCommandMetrics.

parameter.name: metricsRollingPercentileBucketSize
parameter.description: Maximum number of values stored in each bucket of the rolling percentile. This is passed into HystrixRollingPercentile inside HystrixCommandMetrics.

eip.name: recipientList
eip.title: Recipient List
eip.description: Routes messages to a number of dynamically specified recipients (dynamic to)

parameter.name: strategyMethodAllowNull
parameter.description: If this option is false then the aggregate method is not used if there was no data to enrich. If this option is true then null values is used as the oldExchange (when no data to enrich) when using POJOs as the AggregationStrategy

parameter.name: executorServiceRef
parameter.description: Refers to a custom Thread Pool to be used for parallel processing. Notice if you set this option then parallel processing is automatic implied and you do not have to enable that option as well.

parameter.name: expression
parameter.description: Expression that returns which endpoints (url) to send the message to (the recipients). If the expression return an empty value then the message is not sent to any recipients.

parameter.name: cacheSize
parameter.description: Sets the maximum size used by the org.apache.camel.impl.ProducerCache which is used to cache and reuse producers when using this recipient list when uris are reused.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: Sets the description of this node

parameter.name: strategyMethodName
parameter.description: This option can be used to explicit declare the method name to use when using POJOs as the AggregationStrategy.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.description: Sets a total timeout specified in millis when using parallel processing. If the Recipient List hasn't been able to send and process all replies within the given timeframe then the timeout triggers and the Recipient List breaks out and continues. Notice if you provide a TimeoutAwareAggregationStrategy then the timeout method is invoked before breaking out. If the timeout is reached with running tasks still remaining certain tasks for which it is difficult for Camel to shut down in a graceful manner may continue to run. So use this option with a bit of care.

parameter.name: onPrepareRef
parameter.description: Uses the Processor when preparing the org.apache.camel.Exchange to be send. This can be used to deep-clone messages that should be send or any custom logic needed before the exchange is send.

parameter.name: ignoreInvalidEndpoints
parameter.description: Ignore the invalidate endpoint exception when try to create a producer with that endpoint

parameter.name: streaming
parameter.description: If enabled then Camel will process replies out-of-order eg in the order they come back. If disabled Camel will process replies in the same order as defined by the recipient list.

parameter.name: stopOnException
parameter.description: Will now stop further processing if an exception or failure occurred during processing of an org.apache.camel.Exchange and the caused exception will be thrown. Will also stop if processing the exchange failed (has a fault message) or an exception was thrown and handled by the error handler (such as using onException). In all situations the recipient list will stop further processing. This is the same behavior as in pipeline which is used by the routing engine. The default behavior is to not stop but continue processing till the end

parameter.name: delimiter
parameter.description: Delimiter used if the Expression returned multiple endpoints. Can be turned off using the value false. The default value is

parameter.name: parallelProcessing
parameter.description: If enabled then sending messages to the recipients occurs concurrently. Note the caller thread will still wait until all messages has been fully processed before it continues. Its only the sending and processing the replies from the recipients which happens concurrently.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Sets the id of this node

parameter.name: parallelAggregate
parameter.description: If enabled then the aggregate method on AggregationStrategy can be called concurrently. Notice that this would require the implementation of AggregationStrategy to be implemented as thread-safe. By default this is false meaning that Camel synchronizes the call to the aggregate method. Though in some use-cases this can be used to archive higher performance when the AggregationStrategy is implemented as thread-safe.

parameter.name: strategyRef
parameter.description: Sets a reference to the AggregationStrategy to be used to assemble the replies from the recipients into a single outgoing message from the RecipientList. By default Camel will use the last reply as the outgoing message. You can also use a POJO as the AggregationStrategy

parameter.name: shareUnitOfWork
parameter.description: Shares the org.apache.camel.spi.UnitOfWork with the parent and each of the sub messages. Recipient List will by default not share unit of work between the parent exchange and each recipient exchange. This means each sub exchange has its own individual unit of work.

parameter.description: Sets the class name to use for binding from POJO to output for the outgoing data This option will override what may be configured on a parent level

parameter.name: skipBindingOnErrorCode
parameter.description: Whether to skip binding on output if there is a custom HTTP error code header. This allows to build custom error messages that do not bind to json / xml etc as success messages otherwise will do. This option will override what may be configured on a parent level

parameter.name: apiDocs
parameter.description: Whether to include or exclude the VerbDefinition in API documentation. The default value is true.

parameter.name: produces
parameter.description: To define the content type what the REST service produces (uses for output) such as application/xml or application/json This option will override what may be configured on a parent level

parameter.name: toOrRoute
parameter.description: To route from this REST service to a Camel endpoint or an inlined route

parameter.description: To define the content type what the REST service consumes (accept as input) such as application/xml or application/json. This option will override what may be configured on a parent level

parameter.description: References to the org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionTemplate to use with the transaction error handler.

parameter.name: executorServiceRef
parameter.description: Sets a reference to a thread pool to be used by the error handler

parameter.name: redeliveryPolicy
parameter.description: Sets the redelivery settings

parameter.name: level
parameter.description: Logging level to use when using the logging error handler type.

parameter.name: useOriginalMessage
parameter.description: Will use the original input message when an org.apache.camel.Exchange is moved to the dead letter queue. Notice: this only applies when all redeliveries attempt have failed and the org.apache.camel.Exchange is doomed for failure. Instead of using the current inprogress org.apache.camel.Exchange IN body we use the original IN body instead. This allows you to store the original input in the dead letter queue instead of the inprogress snapshot of the IN body. For instance if you route transform the IN body during routing and then failed. With the original exchange store in the dead letter queue it might be easier to manually re submit the org.apache.camel.Exchange again as the IN body is the same as when Camel received it. So you should be able to send the org.apache.camel.Exchange to the same input. By default this feature is off.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: The type of the error handler

parameter.name: deadLetterHandleNewException
parameter.description: Whether the dead letter channel should handle (and ignore) any new exception that may been thrown during sending the message to the dead letter endpoint. The default value is true which means any such kind of exception is handled and ignored. Set this to false to let the exception be propagated back on the org.apache.camel.Exchange. This can be used in situations where you use transactions and want to use Camel's dead letter channel to deal with exceptions during routing but if the dead letter channel itself fails because of a new exception being thrown then by setting this to false the new exceptions is propagated back and set on the org.apache.camel.Exchange which allows the transaction to detect the exception and rollback.

parameter.name: deadLetterUri
parameter.description: The dead letter endpoint uri for the Dead Letter error handler.

parameter.name: onRedeliveryRef
parameter.description: Sets a reference to a processor that should be processed before a redelivery attempt. Can be used to change the org.apache.camel.Exchange before its being redelivered.

parameter.name: retryWhileRef
parameter.description: Sets a reference to an retry while expression. Will continue retrying until expression evaluates to false.

parameter.name: logName
parameter.description: Name of the logger to use for the logging error handler

parameter.name: rollbackLoggingLevel
parameter.description: Sets the logging level to use for logging transactional rollback. This option is default WARN.

parameter.name: transactionManagerRef
parameter.description: References to the org.springframework.transaction.PlatformTransactionManager to use with the transaction error handler.

parameter.name: onPrepareFailureRef
parameter.description: Sets a reference to a processor to prepare the org.apache.camel.Exchange before handled by the failure processor / dead letter channel. This allows for example to enrich the message before sending to a dead letter queue.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Sets the id of this node

parameter.name: onExceptionOccurredRef
parameter.description: Sets a reference to a processor that should be processed just after an exception occurred. Can be used to perform custom logging about the occurred exception at the exact time it happened. Important: Any exception thrown from this processor will be ignored.

parameter.name: redeliveryPolicyRef
parameter.description: Sets a reference to a RedeliveryPolicy to be used for redelivery settings.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: Sets the description of this node

parameter.description: Intercept incoming messages from the uri or uri pattern. If this option is not configured then all incoming messages is intercepted.

parameter.description: Whether to use csv fixed or key value pairs mode.

parameter.description: To configure a default locale to use such as us for united states. To use the JVM platform default locale then use the name default

parameter.name: classType
parameter.description: Name of model class to use.

eip.name: pollEnrich
eip.title: Poll Enrich
eip.description: Enriches messages with data polled from a secondary resource

parameter.name: strategyMethodAllowNull
parameter.description: If this option is false then the aggregate method is not used if there was no data to enrich. If this option is true then null values is used as the oldExchange (when no data to enrich) when using POJOs as the AggregationStrategy.

parameter.name: expression
parameter.description: Expression that computes the endpoint uri to use as the resource endpoint to enrich from

parameter.name: cacheSize
parameter.description: Sets the maximum size used by the org.apache.camel.impl.ConsumerCache which is used to cache and reuse consumers when uris are reused.

parameter.name: ignoreInvalidEndpoint
parameter.description: Ignore the invalidate endpoint exception when try to create a producer with that endpoint

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: Sets the description of this node

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Sets the id of this node

parameter.name: strategyMethodName
parameter.description: This option can be used to explicit declare the method name to use when using POJOs as the AggregationStrategy.

parameter.name: aggregateOnException
parameter.description: If this option is false then the aggregate method is not used if there was an exception thrown while trying to retrieve the data to enrich from the resource. Setting this option to true allows end users to control what to do if there was an exception in the aggregate method. For example to suppress the exception or set a custom message body etc.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.description: Timeout in millis when polling from the external service. The timeout has influence about the poll enrich behavior. It basically operations in three different modes: negative value - Waits until a message is available and then returns it. Warning that this method could block indefinitely if no messages are available. 0 - Attempts to receive a message exchange immediately without waiting and returning null if a message exchange is not available yet. positive value - Attempts to receive a message exchange waiting up to the given timeout to expire if a message is not yet available. Returns null if timed out The default value is -1 and therefore the method could block indefinitely and therefore its recommended to use a timeout value

parameter.name: strategyRef
parameter.description: Refers to an AggregationStrategy to be used to merge the reply from the external service into a single outgoing message. By default Camel will use the reply from the external service as outgoing message.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Sets the value of the id property.

parameter.name: enableCORS
parameter.description: Whether to enable CORS headers in the HTTP response. The default value is false.

parameter.name: component
parameter.description: Sets the component name that this definition will apply to

parameter.name: bindingMode
parameter.description: Sets the binding mode to use. The default value is off

parameter.name: skipBindingOnErrorCode
parameter.description: Whether to skip binding on output if there is a custom HTTP error code header. This allows to build custom error messages that do not bind to json / xml etc as success messages otherwise will do.

parameter.name: produces
parameter.description: To define the content type what the REST service produces (uses for output) such as application/xml or application/json

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: Sets the description of this node

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Sets the id of this node

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: Sets the class name to use for binding from input to POJO for the incoming data

parameter.name: outType
parameter.description: Sets the class name to use for binding from POJO to output for the outgoing data

parameter.name: consumes
parameter.description: To define the content type what the REST service consumes (accept as input) such as application/xml or application/json

parameter.name: schema
parameter.description: To validate against an existing schema. Your can use the prefix classpath: file: or http: to specify how the resource should by resolved. You can separate multiple schema files by using the '' character.

parameter.name: prettyPrint
parameter.description: To enable pretty printing output nicely formatted. Is by default false.

parameter.name: schemaLocation
parameter.description: To define the location of the schema

parameter.name: ignoreJAXBElement
parameter.description: Whether to ignore JAXBElement elements - only needed to be set to false in very special use-cases.

parameter.name: contextPath
parameter.description: Package name where your JAXB classes are located.

parameter.name: xmlStreamWriterWrapper
parameter.description: To use a custom xml stream writer.

parameter.name: noNamespaceSchemaLocation
parameter.description: To define the location of the namespaceless schema

parameter.name: encoding
parameter.description: To overrule and use a specific encoding

parameter.name: filterNonXmlChars
parameter.description: To ignore non xml characheters and replace them with an empty space.

parameter.name: fragment
parameter.description: To turn on marshalling XML fragment trees. By default JAXB looks for XmlRootElement annotation on given class to operate on whole XML tree. This is useful but not always - sometimes generated code does not have XmlRootElement annotation sometimes you need unmarshall only part of tree. In that case you can use partial unmarshalling. To enable this behaviours you need set property partClass. Camel will pass this class to JAXB's unmarshaler.

parameter.name: mustBeJAXBElement
parameter.description: Whether marhsalling must be java objects with JAXB annotations. And if not then it fails. This option can be set to false to relax that such as when the data is already in XML format.

parameter.name: objectFactory
parameter.description: Whether to allow using ObjectFactory classes to create the POJO classes during marshalling. This only applies to POJO classes that has not been annotated with JAXB and providing jaxb.index descriptor files.

parameter.name: namespacePrefixRef
parameter.description: When marshalling using JAXB or SOAP then the JAXB implementation will automatic assign namespace prefixes such as ns2 ns3 ns4 etc. To control this mapping Camel allows you to refer to a map which contains the desired mapping.

parameter.name: partClass
parameter.description: Name of class used for fragment parsing. See more details at the fragment option.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Sets the value of the id property.

parameter.name: partNamespace
parameter.description: XML namespace to use for fragment parsing. See more details at the fragment option.

parameter.name: jaxbProviderProperties
parameter.description: Refers to a custom java.util.Map to lookup in the registry containing custom JAXB provider properties to be used with the JAXB marshaller.

parameter.name: singleton
parameter.description: Not in use

parameter.name: camelContextId
parameter.description: Id of CamelContext to use if there are multiple CamelContexts in the same JVM

parameter.description: Sets the exchange pattern of the endpoint

parameter.name: uri
parameter.description: Sets the URI to use to resolve the endpoint. Notice that additional options can be configured using a series of property.

parameter.name: expression
parameter.description: The expression value in your chosen language syntax

parameter.name: headerName

parameter.name: trim

parameter.name: objectModel

parameter.name: uriDelimiter

eip.description: Routes a copy of a message (or creates a new message) to a secondary destination while continue routing the original message.

parameter.name: processorRef
parameter.description: Reference to a Processor to use for creating a new body as the message to use for wire tapping

parameter.name: executorServiceRef
parameter.description: Uses a custom thread pool

parameter.name: cacheSize
parameter.description: Sets the maximum size used by the org.apache.camel.impl.ConsumerCache which is used to cache and reuse producers.

parameter.name: ignoreInvalidEndpoint
parameter.description: Ignore the invalidate endpoint exception when try to create a producer with that endpoint

parameter.name: pattern
parameter.description: Sets the optional ExchangePattern used to invoke this endpoint

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: Sets the description of this node

parameter.name: copy
parameter.description: Uses a copy of the original exchange

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Sets the id of this node

parameter.name: body
parameter.description: Uses the expression for creating a new body as the message to use for wire tapping

parameter.name: uri
parameter.description: The uri of the endpoint to send to. The uri can be dynamic computed using the org.apache.camel.language.simple.SimpleLanguage expression.

parameter.name: onPrepareRef
parameter.description: Uses the Processor when preparing the org.apache.camel.Exchange to be send. This can be used to deep-clone messages that should be send or any custom logic needed before the exchange is send.

parameter.name: spoolUsedHeapMemoryLimit
parameter.description: Sets what the upper bounds should be when spoolUsedHeapMemoryThreshold is in use.

parameter.name: spoolRules
parameter.description: Reference to one or more custom org.apache.camel.spi.StreamCachingStrategy.SpoolRule to use. Multiple rules can be separated by comma.

parameter.name: spoolChiper
parameter.description: Sets a chiper name to use when spooling to disk to write with encryption. By default the data is not encrypted.

parameter.name: spoolUsedHeapMemoryThreshold
parameter.description: Sets a percentage (1-99) of used heap memory threshold to activate spooling to disk.

parameter.name: statisticsEnabled
parameter.description: Sets whether statistics is enabled.

parameter.name: removeSpoolDirectoryWhenStopping
parameter.description: Whether to remove the temporary directory when stopping. This option is default true

parameter.name: spoolThreshold
parameter.description: Threshold in bytes when overflow to disk is activated. The default threshold is link org.apache.camel.StreamCacheDEFAULT_SPOOL_THRESHOLD bytes (eg 128kb). Use -1 to disable overflow to disk.

parameter.name: anySpoolRules
parameter.description: Sets whether if just any of the org.apache.camel.spi.StreamCachingStrategy.SpoolRule rules returns true then shouldSpoolCache(long) returns true. If this option is false then all the org.apache.camel.spi.StreamCachingStrategy.SpoolRule must return true. The default value is false which means that all the rules must return true.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Sets the id of this node

parameter.name: spoolDirectory
parameter.description: Sets the spool (temporary) directory to use for overflow and spooling to disk. If no spool directory has been explicit configured then a temporary directory is created in the java.io.tmpdir directory.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: Sets whether the stream caching is enabled. Notice: This cannot be changed at runtime.

parameter.name: bufferSize
parameter.description: Sets the buffer size to use when allocating in-memory buffers used for in-memory stream caches. The default size is link org.apache.camel.util.IOHelperDEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE

parameter.name: expression

parameter.name: trim

parameter.name: language

parameter.description: Sets the id of this node

eip.name: tokenize
eip.title: Tokenize
eip.description: For expressions and predicates using a body or header tokenizer

parameter.name: endToken
parameter.description: The end token to use as tokenizer if using start/end token pairs. You can use simple language as the token to support dynamic tokens.

parameter.name: regex
parameter.description: If the token is a regular expression pattern. The default value is false

parameter.name: headerName
parameter.description: Name of header to tokenize instead of using the message body.

parameter.name: includeTokens
parameter.description: Whether to include the tokens in the parts when using pairs The default value is false

parameter.name: trim
parameter.description: Whether to trim the value to remove leading and trailing whitespaces and line breaks

parameter.name: skipFirst
parameter.description: To skip the very first element

parameter.name: xml
parameter.description: Whether the input is XML messages. This option must be set to true if working with XML payloads.

parameter.name: inheritNamespaceTagName
parameter.description: To inherit namespaces from a root/parent tag name when using XML You can use simple language as the tag name to support dynamic names.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Sets the id of this node

parameter.name: token
parameter.description: The (start) token to use as tokenizer for example \n for a new line token. You can use simple language as the token to support dynamic tokens.

parameter.name: group
parameter.description: To group N parts together for example to split big files into chunks of 1000 lines.

parameter.name: expression
parameter.description: The expression value in your chosen language syntax

parameter.name: trim
parameter.description: Whether to trim the value to remove leading and trailing whitespaces and line breaks

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Sets the id of this node

parameter.name: enableCORS
parameter.description: Whether to enable CORS headers in the HTTP response. This option will override what may be configured on a parent level The default value is false.

parameter.name: method
parameter.description: The HTTP verb such as GET or POST

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: Sets the description of this node

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: Sets the class name to use for binding from input to POJO for the incoming data This option will override what may be configured on a parent level

parameter.name: uri
parameter.description: Uri template of this REST service such as /id.

parameter.name: outType
parameter.description: Sets the class name to use for binding from POJO to output for the outgoing data This option will override what may be configured on a parent level

parameter.name: routeId
parameter.description: The route id this rest-dsl is using (read-only)

parameter.name: bindingMode
parameter.description: Sets the binding mode to use. This option will override what may be configured on a parent level The default value is auto

parameter.name: skipBindingOnErrorCode
parameter.description: Whether to skip binding on output if there is a custom HTTP error code header. This allows to build custom error messages that do not bind to json / xml etc as success messages otherwise will do. This option will override what may be configured on a parent level

parameter.name: apiDocs
parameter.description: Whether to include or exclude the VerbDefinition in API documentation. The default value is true.

parameter.name: produces
parameter.description: To define the content type what the REST service produces (uses for output) such as application/xml or application/json This option will override what may be configured on a parent level

parameter.name: toOrRoute
parameter.description: To route from this REST service to a Camel endpoint or an inlined route

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Sets the id of this node

parameter.name: consumes
parameter.description: To define the content type what the REST service consumes (accept as input) such as application/xml or application/json. This option will override what may be configured on a parent level

parameter.name: expression
parameter.description: Expression to define how many times we should loop. Notice the expression is only evaluated once and should return a number as how many times to loop. A value of zero or negative means no looping. The loop is like a for-loop fashion if you want a while loop then the dynamic router may be a better choice.

parameter.name: doWhile
parameter.description: Enables the while loop that loops until the predicate evaluates to false or null.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: Sets the description of this node

parameter.name: copy
parameter.description: If the copy attribute is true a copy of the input Exchange is used for each iteration. That means each iteration will start from a copy of the same message. By default loop will loop the same exchange all over so each iteration may have different message content.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Sets the id of this node

parameter.name: enableCORS
parameter.description: Whether to enable CORS headers in the HTTP response. The default value is false.

parameter.name: scheme
parameter.description: The scheme to use for exposing the REST service. Usually http or https is supported. The default value is http

parameter.name: apiContextPath
parameter.description: Sets a leading API context-path the REST API services will be using. This can be used when using components such as camel-servlet where the deployed web application is deployed using a context-path.

parameter.name: apiContextIdPattern
parameter.description: Sets an CamelContext id pattern to only allow Rest APIs from rest services within CamelContext's which name matches the pattern. The pattern name refers to the CamelContext name to match on the current CamelContext only. For any other value the pattern uses the rules from link org.apache.camel.util.EndpointHelpermatchPattern(String String)

parameter.name: contextPath
parameter.description: Sets a leading context-path the REST services will be using. This can be used when using components such as camel-servlet where the deployed web application is deployed using a context-path. Or for components such as camel-jetty or camel-netty4-http that includes a HTTP server.

parameter.name: apiContextListing
parameter.description: Sets whether listing of all available CamelContext's with REST services in the JVM is enabled. If enabled it allows to discover these contexts if false then only the current CamelContext is in use.

parameter.name: apiContextRouteId
parameter.description: Sets the route id to use for the route that services the REST API. The route will by default use an auto assigned route id.

parameter.name: consumerProperty
parameter.description: Allows to configure as many additional properties for the rest consumer in use.

parameter.name: apiProperty
parameter.description: Allows to configure as many additional properties for the api documentation (swagger). For example set property api.title to my cool stuff

parameter.name: hostNameResolver
parameter.description: If no hostname has been explicit configured then this resolver is used to compute the hostname the REST service will be using.

parameter.name: componentProperty
parameter.description: Allows to configure as many additional properties for the rest component in use.

parameter.name: corsHeaders
parameter.description: Allows to configure custom CORS headers.

parameter.name: component
parameter.description: The Camel Rest component to use for the REST transport (consumer) such as restlet spark-rest. If no component has been explicit configured then Camel will lookup if there is a Camel component that integrates with the Rest DSL or if a org.apache.camel.spi.RestConsumerFactory is registered in the registry. If either one is found then that is being used.

parameter.name: dataFormatProperty
parameter.description: Allows to configure as many additional properties for the data formats in use. For example set property prettyPrint to true to have json outputted in pretty mode. The properties can be prefixed to denote the option is only for either JSON or XML and for either the IN or the OUT. The prefixes are: json.in. json.out. xml.in. xml.out. For example a key with value xml.out.mustBeJAXBElement is only for the XML data format for the outgoing. A key without a prefix is a common key for all situations.

parameter.name: bindingMode
parameter.description: Sets the binding mode to use. The default value is off

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: The port number to use for exposing the REST service. Notice if you use servlet component then the port number configured here does not apply as the port number in use is the actual port number the servlet component is using. eg if using Apache Tomcat its the tomcat http port if using Apache Karaf its the HTTP service in Karaf that uses port 8181 by default etc. Though in those situations setting the port number here allows tooling and JMX to know the port number so its recommended to set the port number to the number that the servlet engine uses.

parameter.name: skipBindingOnErrorCode
parameter.description: Whether to skip binding on output if there is a custom HTTP error code header. This allows to build custom error messages that do not bind to json / xml etc as success messages otherwise will do.

parameter.name: host
parameter.description: The hostname to use for exposing the REST service.

parameter.name: producerApiDoc
parameter.description: Sets the location of the api document (swagger api) the REST producer will use to validate the REST uri and query parameters are valid accordingly to the api document. This requires adding camel-swagger-java to the classpath and any miss configuration will let Camel fail on startup and report the error(s). The location of the api document is loaded from classpath by default but you can use file: or http: to refer to resources to load from file or http url.

parameter.name: producerComponent
parameter.description: Sets the name of the Camel component to use as the REST producer

parameter.name: xmlDataFormat
parameter.description: Name of specific XML data format to use. By default jaxb will be used. Important: This option is only for setting a custom name of the data format not to refer to an existing data format instance.

parameter.name: endpointProperty
parameter.description: Allows to configure as many additional properties for the rest endpoint in use.

parameter.name: apiComponent
parameter.description: The name of the Camel component to use as the REST API (such as swagger)

parameter.name: jsonDataFormat
parameter.description: Name of specific json data format to use. By default json-jackson will be used. Important: This option is only for setting a custom name of the data format not to refer to an existing data format instance.

parameter.name: request
parameter.description: Whether to marshal/unmarshal request or response Is by default false

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Sets the value of the id property.

eip.name: propertiesFunction

eip.description: Function to use with properties placeholder

parameter.name: ref
parameter.description: Reference to the custom properties function to lookup in the registry

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Sets the id of this node

parameter.name: exception
parameter.description: A list of class names for specific exceptions to monitor. If no exceptions is configured then all exceptions is monitored

parameter.name: halfOpenAfter
parameter.description: The timeout in millis to use as threshold to move state from closed to half-open or open state

parameter.name: threshold
parameter.description: Number of previous failed messages to use as threshold to move state from closed to half-open or open state

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Sets the value of the id property.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Sets the value of the id property.

parameter.name: usingParallelCompression
parameter.description: Enable encoding (compress) using multiple processing cores.

parameter.name: addKeyValueForEncryptedKey
parameter.description: Whether to add the public key used to encrypt the session key as a KeyValue in the EncryptedKey structure or not.

parameter.name: keyCipherAlgorithm
parameter.description: The cipher algorithm to be used for encryption/decryption of the asymmetric key. The available choices are: XMLCipher.RSA_v1dot5 XMLCipher.RSA_OAEP XMLCipher.RSA_OAEP_11 The default value is XMLCipher.RSA_OAEP

parameter.name: recipientKeyAlias
parameter.description: The key alias to be used when retrieving the recipient's public or private key from a KeyStore when performing asymmetric key encryption or decryption.

parameter.name: keyPassword
parameter.description: The password to be used for retrieving the private key from the KeyStore. This key is used for asymmetric decryption.

parameter.name: secureTag
parameter.description: The XPath reference to the XML Element selected for encryption/decryption. If no tag is specified the entire payload is encrypted/decrypted.

parameter.name: digestAlgorithm
parameter.description: The digest algorithm to use with the RSA OAEP algorithm. The available choices are: XMLCipher.SHA1 XMLCipher.SHA256 XMLCipher.SHA512 The default value is XMLCipher.SHA1

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Sets the value of the id property.

parameter.name: keyOrTrustStoreParametersId
parameter.description: Refers to a KeyStore instance to lookup in the registry which is used for configuration options for creating and loading a KeyStore instance that represents the sender's trustStore or recipient's keyStore.

parameter.name: xmlCipherAlgorithm
parameter.description: The cipher algorithm to be used for encryption/decryption of the XML message content. The available choices are: XMLCipher.TRIPLEDES XMLCipher.AES_128 XMLCipher.AES_128_GCM XMLCipher.AES_192 XMLCipher.AES_192_GCM XMLCipher.AES_256 XMLCipher.AES_256_GCM XMLCipher.SEED_128 XMLCipher.CAMELLIA_128 XMLCipher.CAMELLIA_192 XMLCipher.CAMELLIA_256 The default value is MLCipher.TRIPLEDES

parameter.name: mgfAlgorithm
parameter.description: The MGF Algorithm to use with the RSA OAEP algorithm. The available choices are: EncryptionConstants.MGF1_SHA1 EncryptionConstants.MGF1_SHA256 EncryptionConstants.MGF1_SHA512 The default value is EncryptionConstants.MGF1_SHA1

parameter.name: passPhrase
parameter.description: A String used as passPhrase to encrypt/decrypt content. The passPhrase has to be provided. If no passPhrase is specified a default passPhrase is used. The passPhrase needs to be put together in conjunction with the appropriate encryption algorithm. For example using TRIPLEDES the passPhase can be a Only another 24 Byte key

parameter.name: secureTagContents
parameter.description: A boolean value to specify whether the XML Element is to be encrypted or the contents of the XML Element false = Element Level true = Element Content Level

parameter.name: id

parameter.name: roundRobin

parameter.name: lookup
parameter.description: How to perform service lookup. Possible values: client dns environment. When using client then the client queries the kubernetes master to obtain a list of active pods that provides the service and then random (or round robin) select a pod. When using dns the service name is resolved as name.namespace.service.dnsDomain. When using environment then environment variables are used to lookup the service. By default environment is used.

parameter.name: caCertData
parameter.description: Sets the Certificate Authority data when using client lookup

parameter.name: oauthToken
parameter.description: Sets the OAUTH token for authentication (instead of username/password) when using client lookup

parameter.description: Sets the Client Keystore algorithm such as RSA when using client lookup

parameter.description: Sets the default Camel component to use for calling the remote service. By default the http component is used. You can configure this to use netty4-http jetty restlet or some other components of choice. If the service is not HTTP protocol you can use other components such as mqtt jms amqp etc. If the service call has been configured using an uri then the component from the uri is used instead of this default component.

parameter.name: apiVersion

parameter.name: clientKeyData
parameter.description: Sets the Client Keystore data when using client lookup

parameter.description: Sets a reference to a custom org.apache.camel.spi.ServiceCallLoadBalancer to use.

parameter.description: Sets the namespace to use. Will by default use namespace from the ENV variable KUBERNETES_MASTER.

parameter.name: clientKeyPassphrase
parameter.description: Sets the Client Keystore passphrase when using client lookup

parameter.description: Sets the username for authentication when using client lookup

parameter.name: ref
parameter.description: Refers to the custom load balancer to lookup from the registry

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Sets the value of the id property.

parameter.name: expression
parameter.description: The expression value in your chosen language syntax

parameter.name: trim
parameter.description: Whether to trim the value to remove leading and trailing whitespaces and line breaks

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Sets the id of this node

parameter.name: batchSize
parameter.description: Sets the size of the batch to be re-ordered. The default size is 100.

parameter.name: reverse
parameter.description: Whether to reverse the ordering.

parameter.name: allowDuplicates
parameter.description: Whether to allow duplicates.

parameter.name: batchTimeout
parameter.description: Sets the timeout for collecting elements to be re-ordered. The default timeout is 1000 msec.

parameter.name: ignoreInvalidExchanges
parameter.description: Whether to ignore invalid exchanges

parameter.name: exception
parameter.description: A list of class names for specific exceptions to monitor. If no exceptions is configured then all exceptions is monitored

parameter.name: sticky
parameter.description: Whether or not the failover load balancer should operate in sticky mode or not. If not then it will always start from the first endpoint when a new message is to be processed. In other words it restart from the top for every message. If sticky is enabled then it keeps state and will continue with the last known good endpoint. You can also enable sticky mode together with round robin if so then it will pick the last known good endpoint to use when starting the load balancing (instead of using the next when starting).

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Sets the value of the id property.

parameter.name: maximumFailoverAttempts
parameter.description: A value to indicate after X failover attempts we should exhaust (give up). Use -1 to indicate never give up and continuously try to failover. Use 0 to never failover. And use e.g. 3 to failover at most 3 times before giving up. his option can be used whether or not roundRobin is enabled or not.

parameter.name: roundRobin
parameter.description: Whether or not the failover load balancer should operate in round robin mode or not. If not then it will always start from the first endpoint when a new message is to be processed. In other words it restart from the top for every message. If round robin is enabled then it keeps state and will continue with the next endpoint in a round robin fashion. You can also enable sticky mode together with round robin if so then it will pick the last known good endpoint to use when starting the load balancing (instead of using the next when starting).

A permission must be configured either here or globally using a JVM system property. The permission can be specified in a syntax where a plus sign is allow and minus sign is deny. Wildcards is supported by using . as prefix. For example to allow com.foo and all subpackages then specfy com.foo.. Multiple permissions can be configured separated by comma such as com.foo.-com.foo.bar.MySecretBean. The following default permission is always included: -java.lang.java.util. unless its overridden by specifying a JVM system property with they key org.apache.camel.xstream.permissions.

parameter.name: permissions
parameter.description: Adds permissions that controls which Java packages and classes XStream is allowed to use during unmarshal from xml/json to Java beans. A permission must be configured either here or globally using a JVM system property. The permission can be specified in a syntax where a plus sign is allow and minus sign is deny. Wildcards is supported by using . as prefix. For example to allow com.foo and all subpackages then specfy com.foo.. Multiple permissions can be configured separated by comma such as com.foo.-com.foo.bar.MySecretBean. The following default permission is always included: -java.lang.java.util. unless its overridden by specifying a JVM system property with they key org.apache.camel.xstream.permissions.

parameter.name: redeliveryPolicy
parameter.description: Set the RedeliveryPolicy to be used.

parameter.description: Sets whether the exchange should handle and continue routing from the point of failure. If this option is enabled then its considered handled as well.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: Sets the description of this node

parameter.name: useOriginalMessage
parameter.description: Will use the original input message when an org.apache.camel.Exchange is moved to the dead letter queue. Notice: this only applies when all redeliveries attempt have failed and the org.apache.camel.Exchange is doomed for failure. Instead of using the current inprogress org.apache.camel.Exchange IN body we use the original IN body instead. This allows you to store the original input in the dead letter queue instead of the inprogress snapshot of the IN body. For instance if you route transform the IN body during routing and then failed. With the original exchange store in the dead letter queue it might be easier to manually re submit the org.apache.camel.Exchange again as the IN body is the same as when Camel received it. So you should be able to send the org.apache.camel.Exchange to the same input. By default this feature is off.

parameter.name: retryWhile
parameter.description: Sets the retry while predicate. Will continue retrying until predicate returns false.

parameter.name: onRedeliveryRef
parameter.description: Sets a reference to a processor that should be processed before a redelivery attempt. Can be used to change the org.apache.camel.Exchange before its being redelivered.

parameter.name: handled
parameter.description: Sets whether the exchange should be marked as handled or not.

parameter.name: onWhen
parameter.description: Sets an additional predicate that should be true before the onException is triggered. To be used for fine grained controlling whether a thrown exception should be intercepted by this exception type or not.

parameter.name: onExceptionOccurredRef
parameter.description: Sets a reference to a processor that should be processed just after an exception occurred. Can be used to perform custom logging about the occurred exception at the exact time it happened. Important: Any exception thrown from this processor will be ignored.

parameter.name: armored
parameter.description: This option will cause PGP to base64 encode the encrypted text making it available for copy/paste etc.

parameter.name: signaturePassword
parameter.description: Password used when opening the private key used for signing (during encryption).

parameter.name: signatureKeyRing
parameter.description: Keyring used for signing/verifying as byte array. You can not set the signatureKeyFileName and signatureKeyRing at the same time.

parameter.name: keyFileName
parameter.description: Filename of the keyring; must be accessible as a classpath resource (but you can specify a location in the file system by using the file: prefix).

parameter.name: signatureVerificationOption
parameter.description: Controls the behavior for verifying the signature during unmarshaling. There are 4 values possible: optional: The PGP message may or may not contain signatures; if it does contain signatures then a signature verification is executed. required: The PGP message must contain at least one signature; if this is not the case an exception (PGPException) is thrown. A signature verification is executed. ignore: Contained signatures in the PGP message are ignored; no signature verification is executed. no_signature_allowed: The PGP message must not contain a signature; otherwise an exception (PGPException) is thrown.

parameter.name: signatureKeyUserid
parameter.description: User ID of the key in the PGP keyring used for signing (during encryption) or signature verification (during decryption). During the signature verification process the specified User ID restricts the public keys from the public keyring which can be used for the verification. If no User ID is specified for the signature verficiation then any public key in the public keyring can be used for the verification. Can also be only a part of a user ID. For example if the user ID is Test User then you can use the part Test User or to address the User ID.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: Password used when opening the private key (not used for encryption).

parameter.name: integrity
parameter.description: Adds an integrity check/sign into the encryption file. The default value is true.

parameter.name: provider
parameter.description: Java Cryptography Extension (JCE) provider default is Bouncy Castle (BC). Alternatively you can use for example the IAIK JCE provider; in this case the provider must be registered beforehand and the Bouncy Castle provider must not be registered beforehand. The Sun JCE provider does not work.

parameter.name: keyUserid
parameter.description: The user ID of the key in the PGP keyring used during encryption. Can also be only a part of a user ID. For example if the user ID is Test User then you can use the part Test User or to address the user ID.

parameter.name: compressionAlgorithm
parameter.description: Compression algorithm; possible values are defined in org.bouncycastle.bcpg.CompressionAlgorithmTags; for example 0 (= UNCOMPRESSED) 1 (= ZIP) 2 (= ZLIB) 3 (= BZIP2). Only relevant for encrypting.

parameter.name: signatureKeyFileName
parameter.description: Filename of the keyring to use for signing (during encryption) or for signature verification (during decryption); must be accessible as a classpath resource (but you can specify a location in the file system by using the file: prefix).

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Sets the value of the id property.

parameter.name: hashAlgorithm
parameter.description: Signature hash algorithm; possible values are defined in org.bouncycastle.bcpg.HashAlgorithmTags; for example 2 (= SHA1) 8 (= SHA256) 9 (= SHA384) 10 (= SHA512) 11 (=SHA224). Only relevant for signing.

parameter.name: algorithm
parameter.description: Symmetric key encryption algorithm; possible values are defined in org.bouncycastle.bcpg.SymmetricKeyAlgorithmTags; for example 2 (= TRIPLE DES) 3 (= CAST5) 4 (= BLOWFISH) 6 (= DES) 7 (= AES_128). Only relevant for encrypting.

parameter.name: multipartSubType
parameter.description: Specify the subtype of the MIME Multipart. Default is mixed.

parameter.name: multipartWithoutAttachment
parameter.description: Defines whether a message without attachment is also marshaled into a MIME Multipart (with only one body part). Default is false.

parameter.name: headersInline
parameter.description: Defines whether the MIME-Multipart headers are part of the message body (true) or are set as Camel headers (false). Default is false.

parameter.name: includeHeaders
parameter.description: A regex that defines which Camel headers are also included as MIME headers into the MIME multipart. This will only work if headersInline is set to true. Default is to include no headers

parameter.name: logExhaustedMessageBody

parameter.name: expandableProperties
parameter.description: With expandable properties JSON array elements are converted to XML as a sequence of repetitive XML elements with the local name equal to the JSON key for example: number: 123 normally converted to: 123 (where e can be modified by setting elementName) would instead translate to 123 if number is set as an expandable property Used for unmarshalling (JSON to XML conversion).

parameter.name: forceTopLevelObject
parameter.description: Determines whether the resulting JSON will start off with a top-most element whose name matches the XML root element. Used for marshalling (XML to JSon conversion). If disabled XML string 12 turns into 'x: '1' 'y': '2' . Otherwise it turns into 'a': 'x: '1' 'y': '2' .

parameter.name: rootName
parameter.description: Specifies the name of the top-level element. Used for unmarshalling (JSON to XML conversion). If not set json-lib will use arrayName or objectName (default value: 'o' at the current time it is not configurable in this data format). If set to 'root' the JSON string 'x': 'value1' 'y' : 'value2' would turn into value1value2 otherwise the 'root' element would be named 'o'.

parameter.name: removeNamespacePrefixes
parameter.description: Removes the namespace prefixes from XML qualified elements so that the resulting JSON string does not contain them. Used for marshalling (XML to JSon conversion).

parameter.name: arrayName
parameter.description: Specifies the name of the top-level XML element. Used for unmarshalling (JSON to XML conversion). For example when converting 1 2 3 it will be output by default as 123. By setting this option or rootName you can alter the name of element 'a'.

parameter.name: encoding
parameter.description: Sets the encoding. Used for unmarshalling (JSON to XML conversion).

parameter.name: elementName
parameter.description: Specifies the name of the XML elements representing each array element. Used for unmarshalling (JSON to XML conversion).

parameter.name: trimSpaces
parameter.description: Determines whether leading and trailing white spaces will be omitted from String values. Used for marshalling (XML to JSon conversion).

parameter.name: typeHints
parameter.description: Adds type hints to the resulting XML to aid conversion back to JSON. Used for unmarshalling (JSON to XML conversion).

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Sets the value of the id property.

parameter.name: namespaceLenient
parameter.description: Flag to be tolerant to incomplete namespace prefixes. Used for unmarshalling (JSON to XML conversion). In most cases json-lib automatically changes this flag at runtime to match the processing.

parameter.name: skipNamespaces

parameter.name: skipWhitespace
parameter.description: Determines whether white spaces between XML elements will be regarded as text values or disregarded. Used for marshalling (XML to JSon conversion).

eip.name: split
eip.title: Split
eip.description: Splits a single message into many sub-messages.

parameter.name: strategyMethodAllowNull
parameter.description: If this option is false then the aggregate method is not used if there was no data to enrich. If this option is true then null values is used as the oldExchange (when no data to enrich) when using POJOs as the AggregationStrategy

parameter.name: executorServiceRef
parameter.description: Refers to a custom Thread Pool to be used for parallel processing. Notice if you set this option then parallel processing is automatic implied and you do not have to enable that option as well.

parameter.name: expression
parameter.description: Expression of how to split the message body such as as-is using a tokenizer or using an xpath.

parameter.name: description
parameter.description: Sets the description of this node

parameter.name: strategyMethodName
parameter.description: This option can be used to explicit declare the method name to use when using POJOs as the AggregationStrategy.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.description: Sets a total timeout specified in millis when using parallel processing. If the Splitter hasn't been able to split and process all the sub messages within the given timeframe then the timeout triggers and the Splitter breaks out and continues. Notice if you provide a TimeoutAwareAggregationStrategy then the timeout method is invoked before breaking out. If the timeout is reached with running tasks still remaining certain tasks for which it is difficult for Camel to shut down in a graceful manner may continue to run. So use this option with a bit of care.

parameter.name: onPrepareRef
parameter.description: Uses the Processor when preparing the org.apache.camel.Exchange to be send. This can be used to deep-clone messages that should be send or any custom logic needed before the exchange is send.

parameter.name: streaming
parameter.description: When in streaming mode then the splitter splits the original message on-demand and each splitted message is processed one by one. This reduces memory usage as the splitter do not split all the messages first but then we do not know the total size and therefore the link org.apache.camel.ExchangeSPLIT_SIZE is empty. In non-streaming mode (default) the splitter will split each message first to know the total size and then process each message one by one. This requires to keep all the splitted messages in memory and therefore requires more memory. The total size is provided in the link org.apache.camel.ExchangeSPLIT_SIZE header. The streaming mode also affects the aggregation behavior. If enabled then Camel will process replies out-of-order eg in the order they come back. If disabled Camel will process replies in the same order as the messages was splitted.

parameter.name: stopOnException
parameter.description: Will now stop further processing if an exception or failure occurred during processing of an org.apache.camel.Exchange and the caused exception will be thrown. Will also stop if processing the exchange failed (has a fault message) or an exception was thrown and handled by the error handler (such as using onException). In all situations the splitter will stop further processing. This is the same behavior as in pipeline which is used by the routing engine. The default behavior is to not stop but continue processing till the end

parameter.name: parallelProcessing
parameter.description: If enabled then processing each splitted messages occurs concurrently. Note the caller thread will still wait until all messages has been fully processed before it continues. Its only processing the sub messages from the splitter which happens concurrently.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Sets the id of this node

parameter.name: parallelAggregate
parameter.description: If enabled then the aggregate method on AggregationStrategy can be called concurrently. Notice that this would require the implementation of AggregationStrategy to be implemented as thread-safe. By default this is false meaning that Camel synchronizes the call to the aggregate method. Though in some use-cases this can be used to archive higher performance when the AggregationStrategy is implemented as thread-safe.

parameter.name: strategyRef
parameter.description: Sets a reference to the AggregationStrategy to be used to assemble the replies from the splitted messages into a single outgoing message from the Splitter. By default Camel will use the original incoming message to the splitter (leave it unchanged). You can also use a POJO as the AggregationStrategy

parameter.name: shareUnitOfWork
parameter.description: Shares the org.apache.camel.spi.UnitOfWork with the parent and each of the sub messages. Splitter will by default not share unit of work between the parent exchange and each splitted exchange. This means each splitted exchange has its own individual unit of work.

parameter.name: onCompletion
parameter.description: Configuration of sub routes to run at the completion of routing.

parameter.name: handleFault
parameter.description: Sets whether fault handling is enabled or not (default is disabled).

parameter.name: useMDCLogging
parameter.description: Set whether MDC is enabled.

parameter.name: dataFormats
parameter.description: Configuration of data formats.

parameter.name: onException
parameter.description: Configuration of error handlers that triggers on exceptions thrown.

parameter.name: streamCache
parameter.description: Sets whether stream caching is enabled or not.

parameter.name: autoStartup
parameter.description: Sets whether the object should automatically start when Camel starts. Important: Currently only routes can be disabled as CamelContexts are always started. Note: When setting auto startup false on CamelContext then that takes precedence and no routes is started. You would need to start CamelContext explicit using the link org.apache.camel.CamelContextstart() method to start the context and then you would need to start the routes manually using link CamelContextstartRoute(String).

parameter.name: packageScan
parameter.description: Sets the package scanning information. Package scanning allows for the automatic discovery of certain camel classes at runtime for inclusion e.g. org.apache.camel.builder.RouteBuilder implementations

parameter.name: depends-on
parameter.description: List of other bean id's this CamelContext depends up. Multiple bean id's can be separated by comma.

parameter.name: trace
parameter.description: Sets whether tracing is enabled or not.

parameter.name: contextScan
parameter.description: Sets the context scanning (eg Spring's ApplicationContext) information. Context scanning allows for the automatic discovery of Camel routes runtime for inclusion e.g. org.apache.camel.builder.RouteBuilder implementations

parameter.name: endpoint
parameter.description: Configuration of endpoints

parameter.name: threadNamePattern
parameter.description: Sets the thread name pattern used for creating the full thread name. The default pattern is: Camel (camelId) thread counter - name Where camelId is the name of the org.apache.camel.CamelContext and counter is a unique incrementing counter. and name is the regular thread name. You can also use longName is the long thread name which can includes endpoint parameters etc.

parameter.name: routeContextRef
parameter.description: Refers to XML routes to include as routes in this CamelContext.

parameter.name: interceptSendToEndpoint
parameter.description: Configuration of interceptors that triggers sending messages to endpoints.

parameter.name: typeConverterStatisticsEnabled
parameter.description: Sets whether or not type converter statistics is enabled. By default the type converter utilization statistics is disabled. Notice: If enabled then there is a slight performance impact under very heavy load. You can enable/disable the statistics at runtime using the link org.apache.camel.spi.TypeConverterRegistrygetStatistics()setTypeConverterStatisticsEnabled(Boolean) method or from JMX on the org.apache.camel.api.management.mbean.ManagedTypeConverterRegistryMBean mbean.

parameter.name: restConfiguration
parameter.description: Configuration for rest-dsl

parameter.name: beans
parameter.description: Miscellaneous configurations

parameter.name: messageHistory
parameter.description: Sets whether message history is enabled or not.

parameter.name: delayer
parameter.description: Sets a delay value in millis that a message is delayed at every step it takes in the route path slowing the process down to better observe what is occurring

parameter.name: useBreadcrumb
parameter.description: Set whether breadcrumb is enabled.

parameter.name: managementNamePattern
parameter.description: The naming pattern for creating the CamelContext management name.

parameter.name: threadPool
parameter.description: Configuration of thread pool

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: Sets the id (name) of this CamelContext

parameter.name: logExhaustedMessageBody
parameter.description: Sets whether to log exhausted message body with message history.

parameter.name: allowUseOriginalMessage
parameter.description: Sets whether to allow access to the original message from Camel's error handler or from link org.apache.camel.spi.UnitOfWorkgetOriginalInMessage(). Turning this off can optimize performance as defensive copy of the original message is not needed.

parameter.name: restContextRef
parameter.description: Refers to XML rest-dsl to include as REST services in this CamelContext.

parameter.name: rest
parameter.description: Contains the rest services defined using the rest-dsl

parameter.name: package
parameter.description: Sets the package names to be recursively searched for Java classes which extend org.apache.camel.builder.RouteBuilder to be auto-wired up to the CamelContext as a route. Note that classes are excluded if they are specifically configured in the spring.xml A more advanced configuration can be done using link setPackageScan(org.apache.camel.model.PackageScanDefinition)

parameter.name: shutdownEager
parameter.description: Whether to shutdown CamelContext eager when Spring is shutting down. This ensure a cleaner shutdown of Camel as dependent bean's are not shutdown at this moment. The bean's will then be shutdown after camelContext.

parameter.name: typeConverterExists
parameter.description: What should happen when attempting to add a duplicate type converter. The default behavior is to override the existing.

parameter.name: propertyPlaceholder
parameter.description: Configuration of property placeholder

parameter.name: typeConverterExistsLoggingLevel
parameter.description: The logging level to use when logging that a type converter already exists when attempting to add a duplicate type converter. The default logging level is WARN

parameter.name: errorHandlerRef
parameter.description: Sets the name of the error handler object used to default the error handling strategy

parameter.name: runtimeEndpointRegistryEnabled
parameter.description: Sets whether org.apache.camel.spi.RuntimeEndpointRegistry is enabled.

parameter.name: route
parameter.description: Contains the Camel routes

parameter.name: intercept
parameter.description: Configuration of interceptors.

parameter.name: shutdownRoute
parameter.description: Sets the ShutdownRoute option for routes.

parameter.name: shutdownRunningTask
parameter.description: Sets the ShutdownRunningTask option to use when shutting down a route.

parameter.name: routeBuilder
parameter.description: Refers to Java RouteBuilder instances to include as routes in this CamelContext.

parameter.name: streamCaching
parameter.description: Configuration of stream caching.

parameter.name: redeliveryPolicyProfile
parameter.description: Configuration of redelivery settings.

parameter.name: lazyLoadTypeConverters
parameter.description: Sets whether type converters should be loaded lazy

parameter.name: jmxAgent
parameter.description: Configuration of JMX.

parameter.name: properties
parameter.description: Configuration of CamelContext properties such as limit of debug logging and other general options.

parameter.name: threadPoolProfile

parameter.name: interceptFrom
parameter.description: Configuration of interceptors that triggers from the beginning of routes.

parameter.name: fallbackViaNetwork
parameter.description: Whether the fallback goes over the network. If the fallback will go over the network it is another possible point of failure and so it also needs to be wrapped by a HystrixCommand. It is important to execute the fallback command on a separate thread-pool otherwise if the main command were to become latent and fill the thread-pool this would prevent the fallback from running if the two commands share the same pool.

eip.name: enrich

eip.description: Enriches a message with data from a secondary resource

parameter.name: strategyMethodAllowNull
parameter.description: If this option is false then the aggregate method is not used if there was no data to enrich. If this option is true then null values is used as the oldExchange (when no data to enrich) when using POJOs as the AggregationStrategy.

parameter.name: expression
parameter.description: Expression that computes the endpoint uri to use as the resource endpoint to enrich from

parameter.name: cacheSize

parameter.name: aggregateOnException
parameter.description: If this option is false then the aggregate method is not used if there was an exception thrown while trying to retrieve the data to enrich from the resource. Setting this option to true allows end users to control what to do if there was an exception in the aggregate method. For example to suppress the exception or set a custom message body etc.

parameter.name: strategyRef

parameter.name: shareUnitOfWork
parameter.description: Shares the org.apache.camel.spi.UnitOfWork with the parent and the resource exchange. Enrich will by default not share unit of work between the parent exchange and the resource exchange. This means the resource exchange has its own individual unit of work.

parameter.name: schema
parameter.description: To validate against an existing schema. Your can use the prefix classpath: file: or http: to specify how the resource should by resolved. You can separate multiple schema files by using the '' character.

parameter.name: namespacePrefixRef
parameter.description: When marshalling using JAXB or SOAP then the JAXB implementation will automatic assign namespace prefixes such as ns2 ns3 ns4 etc. To control this mapping Camel allows you to refer to a map which contains the desired mapping.

parameter.name: elementNameStrategyRef
parameter.description: Refers to an element strategy to lookup from the registry. An element name strategy is used for two purposes. The first is to find a xml element name for a given object and soap action when marshaling the object into a SOAP message. The second is to find an Exception class for a given soap fault name. The following three element strategy class name is provided out of the box. QNameStrategy - Uses a fixed qName that is configured on instantiation. Exception lookup is not supported TypeNameStrategy - Uses the name and namespace from the XMLType annotation of the given type. If no namespace is set then package-info is used. Exception lookup is not supported ServiceInterfaceStrategy - Uses information from a webservice interface to determine the type name and to find the exception class for a SOAP fault All three classes is located in the package name org.apache.camel.dataformat.soap.name If you have generated the web service stub code with cxf-codegen or a similar tool then you probably will want to use the ServiceInterfaceStrategy. In the case you have no annotated service interface you should use QNameStrategy or TypeNameStrategy.
